message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.CY, cs.SC 

This paper deals with the security and reliability of Bitcoin transactions, which falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). It also involves distributed computing (cs.DC) as it discusses the potential disruption of protocols. The use of deposits and refunds in Bitcoin transactions also relates to data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) and complexity theory (cs.CY). Finally, the concept of fairness in two-party computations using Bitcoin protocol may also fall under the category of social and information networks (cs.SC).
